conclusion: Analyze forces acting on rods a and b considering electromagnetic force and applied force.
Calculate EMF in rod a using formula: EMF = B L v_a sin(theta).
Given values: B = 0.2 T, L = 0.5 m, v_a = 1.0 m/s, theta = 30 degrees.
Substitute values into EMF equation to find EMF = 0.05 V.
Calculate current I using Ohm's Law: I = EMF / (2R).
Given values: R = 0.1 Ohm, EMF = 0.05 V.
Substitute values into current equation to find I = 0.25 A.
Calculate electromagnetic force on rod a: F_a = I L B cos(theta).
Use value of cos(30 degrees) = sqrt(3)/2.
Substitute values into force equation to find F_a = 0.0217 N.
Calculate net force on rod a: F_net = F - F_a.
Given applied force F = 2 N.
Substitute values into net force equation to find F_net = 1.9783 N.
Calculate acceleration of rod a using Newton's Second Law: a = F_net / m_a.
Given mass of rod a: m_a = 0.3 kg.
Substitute values into acceleration equation to find a = 6.5943 m/s^2.
Calculate acceleration of rod b: a_b = F_a / m_b.
Given mass of rod b: m_b = 0.1 kg.
Substitute values into acceleration equation to find a_b = 0.217 m/s^2.
Use kinematic equation to find speed of rod b: v_b = a_b t.
Assume same time t for both rods to reach their velocities.
Given v_a = 1.0 m/s, find v_b = 0.217 m/s.
